companyDescription:
Agoda is transforming travel for millions of customers across the globe. 

Headquartered in Asia, Agoda is one of the world’s largest online travel platforms. Founded in 2005 and now part of Booking Holdings (Nasdaq:BKNG), Agoda has a network of over 2,900,000 properties worldwide. Our web and mobile products provide a first-rate reservation service in 38 languages that uniquely combines local knowledge and local connections to provide the best deals for business and leisure travelers.

Agoda employs over 7,000 professionals from 90 nationalities in locations around the globe. In every department – from engineering to customer experience – we provide an environment rich with creativity, collaboration, and experimentation, and the tools to work faster and smarter.

At Agoda, we believe our people are our strength. We work hard and have fun, and we choose people who are dedicated to making things great.

For properties seeking partnership with Agoda, visit https://connect.agoda.com

jobTitle: Analyste de données, Développement de produits
jobDescription:
Nous sommes à la recherche d’une personne spécialiste en données de développement de produits relevant du Chef de service Responsable des processus de définition de produits pour nous aider à définir et à maintenir les données des équipes de développement de produits. Dans ce rôle, vous contribuerez de manière significative à la transformation numérique de l'organisation. Vous serez faire partie d'une équipe de projet incroyable qui mettra en œuvre de nouveaux processus, les derniers et meilleurs outils de gestion du cycle de vie des produits (PLM) et redéfinira les modèles de données, tout ça TOUT À LA FOIS!.
Chez BRP, nous créons de nouvelles façons de déplacer les gens, de sorte que leurs expériences se mesurent par l’émotion plutôt que par la distance. Partout sur le globe, nos produits, nos succès et nos aspirations sont le reflet du savoir-faire exceptionnel de nos gens. Voulez-vous contribuer à cette aventure?
VOUS AUREZ L’OCCASION DE :
Développer des définitions de données, des modèles d'information, des normes de données, des règles de gouvernance et des processus de gestion des données; pensez aux configurations de produit, à la nomenclature, aux plans de processus, à la CAO et encore plus de données créées pendant le développement du produit.Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les responsables de processus pour définir les exigences autour des données et les traduire en fonctions techniques avec le service informatique et les partenaires; être la colle pour Processus-Gens-OutilsCommuniquer des concepts techniques et complexes à tous pour améliorer la compréhension commune et conduire les décisions; démocratisons les données ensembleÊtre responsable de la conception et du déploiement d'une architecture de données maîtres qui prend en charge les processus d'affaires dans le développement et la gestion de produits; tirez parti de votre dynamisme, de votre créativité et de vos compétences en résolution de problèmes pour réussir cette transformation majeure
VOUS VOUS ÉPANOUIREZ DANS CE RÔLE SI VOUS AVEZ LES COMPÉTENCES ET QUALITÉS SUIVANTES :
Vous essayez de comprendre comment l'entreprise et les données sont connectées même en dehors de votre travailVous êtes titulaire d'un baccalauréat en informatique, en systèmes d'information, en administration des affaires, en statistiques, en mathématiques, en génie informatique ou dans un autre domaine pertinentVous aimez utiliser vos compétences en résolution de problèmes et en analyse pour lier un élément technique (par exemple, les modèles de données) aux éléments opérationnels de l'entreprise (par exemple, la cartographie des processus métier) et proposer des solutions.Vous agissez en tant que traducteur de données; être capable de concilier ce que disent les membres de l'équipe de différents horizons, combler le fossé entre les affaires et la techniqueVous avez de l'expérience dans le développement de produits et le PLM? Parlez-nous-en, cela pourrait être votre différenciateur!Notre équipe est basée au Québec, mais nous travaillons avec des gens du monde entier, vous devrez donc maîtriser le français et l'anglais pour échanger avec tous les membres de l'équipe et partenaires.Vous avez d’autres compétences? Dites-nous ce qui vous rend unique et qui ferait de vous un bon ajout à l’équipe.
Vous vous reconnaissez? Nous avons hâte de recevoir votre candidature!
LORSQU’IL EST QUESTION D’AVANTAGES CHEZ BRP, NOUS Y METTONS LE PAQUET.
Cela commence par une base solide. Nous avons ce que vous voulez :
Une prime annuelle : nous travaillons fort, nous le savons. Ce gage de remerciement annuel vient nourrir vos rêves.Des congés payés nombreux : faire une pause est tout aussi important que de créer l'avenir de produits récréatifs. Un régime de retraite : nous voulons nous assurer que vous pourrez profiter de votre retraite; on est là pour vous.Possibilités d’épargne collective : faire partie de l’équipe BRP vous permet de tirer profit de la force de nos programmes d’épargne. Des soins de santé à la tête de l’industrie : entièrement couvert par BRP, ce programme est conçu pour vous, quoi qu’il arrive, afin que vous puissiez vous concentrer sur ce qui comptent pour vous.
Pourquoi ne pas vous en offrir plus :
Des horaires de travail flexibles : l’équilibre constitue la clé de l’innovation. Nous voulons donc nous assurer d’être à notre meilleur grâce à un horaire qui convient à nos rythmes de vie.Un horaire d’été : le temps passe vite chez BRP; nous faisons donc une pause pour profiter de temps de qualité.Un arrêt pendant les fêtes : entre Noël et le Nouvel An, nous fermons nos installations pour faire le plein de moments agréables.Des ressources éducatives : vous aimez ce que vous faites, nous vous offrons les ressources pertinentes pour perfectionner vos compétences pour avancer, ensemble.Des rabais sur les produits BRP : nous fabriquons des produits sensationnels, libérateurs et révolutionnaires; et vous devriez pouvoir vivre ces expériences en premier.
BIENVENUE CHEZ BRP
Leader mondial dans le domaine des véhicules et des bateaux récréatifs, nous créons des moyens innovants de se déplacer sur la neige, l'eau, l'asphalte, la terre et… même dans les airs. Ayant son siège social dans la ville de Valcourt, au Québec, notre entreprise est ancrée dans une tradition d'ingéniosité et d’attention particulière à notre clientèle. Aujourd'hui, nous avons des usines de fabrication au Canada, aux États-Unis, au Mexique, en Finlande, en Australie et en Autriche. Nous comptons près de 20 000 personnes dynamiques, propulsées par la conviction profonde qu'au travail comme dans la vie, l'important n'est pas la destination. C’est le voyage.
LA RÉGION A TOUT POUR PLAIRE! >
companyDescription:
We create innovative ways to move – on snow, on water, on asphalt or dirt – even in the air.

Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, BRP has been reimagining the way you access your world since 2003 and beyond. Building on a tradition of ingenuity and intense customer focus that go all the way back to 1937, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Austria and Australia. We have a total workforce of more than 14,500 driven, resourceful people.

Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products comprises Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex boats and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts and recreational aircraft. We support our product lines with a dedicated parts, accessories and clothing business, to fully enhance your riding experience.

Because it’s not about the destination. It’s about the journey. Yours.

Follow us /// Suivez-nous:
Facebook: @brpinfo
Twitter: @BRPnews /// @BRPnouvelles 
YouTube: CommunicationsBRP

jobDescription:
Aidez-nous à façonner audacieusement le commerce de détail au Canada.

La riche tradition de la Société Canadian Tire de servir les Canadiens d’un océan à l’autre remonte à 1922. Notre vision est de devenir la première marque de détail au Canada et nous mettons l’accent sur l’innovation et les investissements importants dans notre Société, surtout lorsqu’il s’agit de nos employés. Pour atteindre notre objectif, nous avons besoin des meilleurs talents pour nous aider à évoluer et à susciter le changement dans l’ensemble de l’entreprise – et à faire partie des pionniers du secteur de la vente au détail au Canada. Alors que nous nous efforçons d’être à l’avant-garde d’un secteur de la vente au détail complexe et en pleine évolution, le moment est propice pour se joindre à la famille d’entreprises Canadian Tire, car elle connaît une période particulièrement exaltante.

En vous joignant à l’équipe de Canadian Tire, dans la division de FGL Sports, vous travaillerez au sein d’une équipe d’analystes en gestion des datas. Votre rôle à titre d’analyste des données sera d’appuyer l’architecture des datas dans le développement des différents besoins en requêtes auprès de multiples sources de base de données de l’entreprise. Vous devrez concevoir, réaliser et gérer la structure des systèmes de rapports. L’analyste de données est responsable des initiatives d’extractions de données de nos différents systèmes, de la validation auprès des départements de l’entreprise quant aux demandes ponctuelles et aux développements de projets.

Vos principales fonctions
Appuyer les différentes demandes provenant de l’entreprise en étant responsable de l’optimisation et de la création de requêtes SQL.Concevoir, réaliser, livrer et gérer des modèles et des rapports à l’aide d’Excel et Power BIPrésentation des données à partir de multiples sources de base de données de l’entreprise.Participer à l’architecture des données et la conception de la solution des données de nos différents systèmes.Collaborer avec les analystes dans l’élaboration des connexions et des extractions avec nos différentes bases de données (« DataLake », Dynamics AX ou Dynamics 365, Azure, I Hub ingestion).Soutenir les validations des données lors de l’intégration des systèmes sous différentes plateformesAnalyser les impacts dans les systèmes déjà existants lors des demandes de changements ; Analyser et collaborer les spécifications structurelles pour les nouveaux logiciels et les nouvelles applicationsDévelopper une compréhension approfondie des différents processusPrendre en charge la documentation des processus et fournir des recommandations d’automatisationParticiper aux ateliers de travail afin de recueillir les exigences et de formuler des recommandations concernant les solutions de rapports et de BIConvertir les processus en exigences fonctionnelles d’une manière claire et compréhensible pour les développeurs et les équipes de projet;Tirer profit de la connaissance des produits de données spécifiques disponibles ainsi que les capacités de visualisation pour améliorer les exigences et offrir des suggestions pertinentes aux parties prenantes.Hiérarchiser les tâches avec l’équipe et s’assurer de la disponibilité de feuilles de route prospectives pour les fonctionnalités devant être fournies sur les produits de données relevant de l’équipe.Collaborer avec les analystes d’Intelligence d’affaires et le département IT dans la réalisation des différents besoins, ainsi qu’aux activités de maintenance et d’évolution.

Vos Qualifications Et Compétences
Baccalauréat en discipline quantitative (mathématiques, statistiques, informatique, économique)Expérience de plus de 3 ans en analyse des données et bonne compréhension de l’architecture des données.Connaissance pratique des concepts et de la terminologie d’IA et de l’entrepôt de données;Excellentes compétences en Excel, notamment avec l’utilisation de formules et de macros avancées;Connaissance approfondie de SQL, ETL, Power BI (conception de rapports & visualisation) et Microsoft Azure.Expérience en Microsoft Dynamics AX ou Dynamics 365(atout) ou connaissance en Thoughtspot (atout)Expérience en analyse, modélisation, vérification et développement de méthodologies d’exigences commerciales et techniques;Capacité à établir, à documenter et à communiquer les normes, politiques, directives et structures de gouvernance en matière de modélisation de données. Capacité de hiérarchiser les projets en respectant les échéanciers.Motivé et capable de travailler de manière autonomeExcellentes aptitudes à la communication orale et écrite avec la capacité de faire le lien et de décrire les situations à l’aide de données; Capacité à expliquer des phénomènes complexes de façon claire et concise à tout type d’audience ;Personne minutieuse et passionnée par la qualité et les nouvelles technologies.Excellente maîtrise du français et de l'anglais, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit

Canadian Tire et sa famille d’entreprises façonnent audacieusement le commerce de détail au Canada et nous continuons d’offrir une expérience positive à nos clients. Étant l’une des marques les plus fiables au Canada, nos employés sont fiers du travail que nous accomplissons partout au pays. Ce n’est pas que le triangle emblématique qui nous permet de garder nos employés. Les avantages sociaux, les occasions d’apprentissage et de perfectionnement et notre engagement envers Bon départ sont quelques-unes des nombreuses raisons pour lesquelles la Société Canadian Tire est l’une des sociétés les mieux gérées au Canada.

Pour en savoir plus sur cette équipe et la famille d’entreprises Canadian Tire, suivez-nous sur LinkedIn.

Canadian Tire souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Nous nous engageons à offrir un milieu de travail diversifié et inclusif pour tous. Nous sommes conscients que notre succès futur dépend du point de vue et des contributions de tous nos employés – leurs antécédents, leurs compétences et leurs expériences d’une grande diversité renforcent notre Société. Si l’on communique avec vous pour une possibilité d’emploi, veuillez nous indiquer tout ajustement nécessaire pour nous assurer que vous ayez accès à un processus de recrutement et de sélection juste et équitable. Les renseignements fournis seront traités de manière confidentielle et utilisés uniquement dans le but d’offrir une expérience accessible à nos candidats.
companyDescription:
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class owned brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast.
 
We are a group of companies that includes a retail segment, a financial services division and CT REIT. Our retail business is led by Canadian Tire, which was founded in 1922 and provides Canadians with products for life in Canada across its Living, Playing, Fixing, Automotive and Seasonal & Gardening categories. Party City, PartSource and Gas+ are key parts of the Canadian Tire network. Our retail segment also includes Mark's, a leading source for casual and industrial wear, Pro Hockey Life, a hockey speciality store catering to elite athletes, and SportChek, Hockey Experts, Sports Experts, and Atmosphere, which offer the best active wear brands. Our 1,700 retail and gasoline outlets are supported and strengthened by our Financial Services division and the tens of thousands of people employed across the country by our Company, local Dealers, franchisees and petroleum retailers. In addition, CTC owns and operates Helly Hansen, a leading technical outdoor brand based in Oslo, Norway.
 
CTC is an integral part of the communities in which we operate and our legacy of community support, through national and local programs, is initiated and executed by our Corporation, Dealers, franchisees, store operators and employees. Since 2005, our Canadian Tire Jumpstart Charities has been helping kids overcome financial and accessibility barriers to sport and recreation in an effort to provide inclusive play for all kids of all abilities.
 
For more information, visit corp.canadiantire.ca.

jobTitle: Data Modelling & Analytics Specialist, IC & Nutrition NA
jobDescription:
Background & Purpose of the Job

The Data Modelling and Analytics role is responsible for creating and maintaining in-house solutions for agile digital measurement. In this role you will leverage current technology and data partners while also exploring new methodologies and partnerships. The primary goal is to help connect digital campaigns run in the Digital Marketing, Media, and Commerce Hub to the short-term sales impact at a granular level (audience, creative, data tactic, etc). This role will also include a focus on Unilever’s First Party Data to support the holistic measurement of one of Unilever’s most critical data sources.

The ideal candidate will be comfortable with advanced statistical methods as well as common media and sales data in the Fast-Moving Consumer Goods world. The agile nature of these projects is also a key feature of this role – candidates need to be comfortable both designing a simple solution from scratch and building on top of the current infrastructure. 

Who You Are & What You’ll Do
Delivery of end to end projects to uncover insights via the statistical analysis of multiple data sources and advanced analytics, especially media insightsBuild statistical / machine learning models for repeated use across brands in Nutrition and Ice CreamSupport ROI measurement for all digital activitiesMaintain previously designed tools and support the data engineering required
Secondary Responsibilities
Develop guidelines on when different methodologies should be usedTrain other data scientists/analysts how to use the tools created to be used for brands outside of Nutrition and Ice CreamAssist in any type of ask that would require advanced analytics
What You’ll Need To Succeed
Statistical / econometric / numerical / engineering / computer science background (degree or equivalent)Strong data modelling/machine learning/deep learning experienceStrong working knowledge of some of the following: Java, JavaScript, Python, PySpark, SQL, RExperience of working with APIs (knowledge of building APIs preferred)Working knowledge of building data pipelinesSubstantial business experienceExperience with consumer goods data setsExperience with different analytics tools
Secondary Traits
Experience driving business value from consumer insightExperience creating user-friendly analytical “data products”, such as a visualization or repeatable analysis capability that can be accessed by less-technical usersExperience coordinating the introduction of a new internal service or capability at a major organization.Interest in one of machine learning, artificial intelligence or natural language processingPassion for the social & digital world and its implications for business
What We Can Offer You

Culture for Growth | Top Notch Employee Health & Well Being Benefits | Every Voice Matters | Global Reach | Unilever: Life | LinkedIn | Strategy | Unilever | Why work for Unilever | Careers at Unilever | Unilever Global Website | Check Out Our Space

For office-based, Research & Development, and remote positions, proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required to be eligible for employment. Religious and/or medical accommodations will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

Unilever Canada is an organization committed to diversity and inclusion to drive our business results and create a better future every day for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national or ethnic origin, marital status, family status, disability, genetic characteristics, and a conviction for which a pardon has been granted.

If you are an individual with a disability in need of assistance at any time during our recruitment process, please contact us at NA.Accommodations@unilever.com. Please note: These lines are reserved for individuals with disabilities in need of assistance and are not a means of inquiry about positions or application statuses.

Unilever Canada est une organisation engagé à la diversité et à l'inclusion pour stimuler nos résultats d'affaires et créer un meilleur avenir chaque jour pour nos employés, les consommateurs globaux, les partenaires et les communautés. Nous croyons qu'un effectif diversifiée nous permet de faire correspondre nos ambitions de croissance et de stimuler l'inclusion dans l'entreprise. Tous les candidats qualifiés recevront la considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, la couleur, la religion, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité ou l'expression de genre, l'âge, l'origine nationale ou ethnique, l'état matrimonial, la situation familiale, l'invalidité, les caractéristiques génétique, et une condamnation pour laquelle un pardon a été accordée.

companyDescription:
Be part of the world’s most successful, purpose-led business. Work with brands that are well-loved around the world, that improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We promote innovation, big and small, to make our business win and grow; and we believe in business as a force for good. Unleash your curiosity, challenge ideas and disrupt processes; use your energy to make this happen. Our brilliant business leaders and colleagues provide mentorship and inspiration, so you can be at your best. 

Our portfolio ranges from nutritionally balanced foods to indulgent ice creams, affordable soaps, luxurious shampoos and everyday household care products. We produce world-leading brands including Lipton, Knorr, Dove, Axe, Hellmann’s and Omo, alongside trusted local names and innovative-forward thinking brands like Ben & Jerry’s, The Dollar Shave Club and Dermalogica. 

Every individual here can bring their purpose to life through their work. Join us and you’ll be surrounded by inspiring leaders and supportive peers. Among them, you’ll channel your purpose, bring fresh ideas to the table, and simply be you. As you work to make a real impact on the business and the world, we’ll work to help you become a better you.
jobIndustries: Consumer Goods, Food Production, Food & Beverages

jobDescription:
123Dentist is Canada's oldest and largest dentist-owned network of dental practices with more than 425 locations nationwide and more than 5,000 employees and growing. We provide Canadian dentists and dental practices with an array of non-clinical support and resources, including accounting, HR, marketing, as well as supply & equipment procurement.

By leveraging our unmatched management experience, marketing expertise and state-of-the-art technologies, we allow dentists to take advantage of a practical and effective alternative to practice ownership and focus on what they're best at - being a dentist!

As we continue to grow, we are seeking a Junior Data Analyst, Business Intelligence to join our team. This role is based at either Toronto North York Office or Toronto Head Office (on-site position).

Job Overview:

Reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence, Junior Data Analyst, Business Intelligence will be a key player on the BI team, contributing to the overall success of 123Dentist Operations and Finance. This opportunity will be a perfect fit for an individual with an analytical mindset, a willingness to explore metrics in creative ways, and a keen interest in delivering information in an organized and meaningful way.

Responsibilities and Duties:
Expand Azure Data Factory and Power BI solution to onboard the 123Dentist practices and new acquisitions. Work with Team Lead to plan test schedules or strategies in accordance with project scope or delivery dates. Perform a variety of quality control functions that support data quality in reconciliation processes, test for compliance with department standards, and identify potential risks. Create and maintain data mapping files. Assist in the maintenance of ETL process and daily data refreshing in Azure Data Factory, SQL database, and Power BI. Assist with ad-hoc tasks as required. Works closely with Business users to troubleshoot data issues in data warehouse and create ad hoc reports. 

Education, Credentials, Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computing and Financial Management, Statistics and Actuarial Science, or similar formal education1-3 years experience in ETL (Extract, transform, load), Power BI, or Data Warehouse. Experience with the Microsoft Azure platform would be an asset. 

Required Skills & Abilities:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills. Good organizational and time management skills. Ability to independently analyze extensive data, identify discrepancies and inconsistencies and recommend a course of corrective action. Experience with ETL, ETL tools, SQL Query, and stored procedures. Experience with a major visualization platform: Power BI, Tableau, Excel pivot table, etc. Experience with building data solutions on Azure or any other Cloud provider. Experience working on teams using agile development techniques. Positive attitude and ability to effectively work with team members in achieving common objectives. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills for interacting with various levels of stakeholders. Ability to manage multiple projects and adapt to changing priorities. 

Working Conditions:
Dynamic work environment and an excellent corporate culture. Ability to adapt to a changing and growing business environment. 

We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
companyDescription: 123Dentist is a leading dental support organization in Canada. It has grown from a single practice in Vancouver, owned by CEO Dr. Amin Shivji and two partners, to more than 425 supported practices and over 5,000 team members serving over 2.5 million patient visits annually. In 2022, 123Dentist merged with Altima Dental and Lapointe Group to create one of the largest, and the oldest, network of dental practices in Canada.  123Dentist was founded on two key principles: putting patient care above all else; and that supported dentists and staff are the most important factors in keeping patients happy. 123Dentist’s vision is to be the dental support community all Canadian dentists and dental professionals want to belong to. 123Dentist offers alternative partnership models to meet the needs of each individual dentist, including the opportunity to retain ownership of the clinic. This unique model enables supported dentists to focus on providing optimal care to patients, while an experienced team provides a wide range of support services.  For more information, please visit: 123dentist.com

jobDescription:
Job Description
Infosys is seeking a Data Analysis. This position will interface with key stakeholders and apply technical proficiency across different stages of the Software Development Life Cycle including Requirements Elicitation, Application Architecture definition and Design; play an important role in creating the high level design artifacts; deliver high quality code deliverables for a module, lead validation for all types of testing and support activities related to implementation, transition and warranty. This is an opportunity to be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued.
Required Qualifications
 Candidate must be located within commuting distance of Mississauga, Ontario or be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel.  Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.  At least 4 years of Information Technology experience.  Canadian citizens and those authorized to work in the Canada are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.   Preferred Qualification : 
 Develop, implement and maintain Tableau analytical dashboards to support business and IT groups across the organization  Design and implement reporting and visualization for unstructured and structured data sets  Write and optimize SQL queries  Provide technical support in defining a business partner approach to self-service  Create template for Dashboards/Reports to be used by other BI Analyst and End Users  Design, develop and operationalize dashboards and reports for Senior and Executive Management  Provide expertise on how to use the Tableau in performing Analysis  Provide best practices and industry standards to guide BI strategies development  Ensure a consistent design and/or approach for analytics across the business areas  Analysis, design and development services for Tableau workbooks in support of the Analytics environment  About Us 
Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

jobDescription:
Description de poste
CGI est à la recherche d’un architecte BI ayant de l’expérience dans la mise en place d'entrepôts de données et l'exploitions de celles-ci.
Fonctions et responsabilités
Élaborer les besoins d’affaires du client par rapport aux besoins analytiques recherchés;
 Modéliser les bases de données (entrepôt et cube multidimensionnel); Rédiger le « mapping » des données; Effectuer le profilage des données et évaluer la faisabilité et les enjeux d’intégration; Définir les spécifications fonctionnelles et techniques reliées aux traitements de données; Définir le plan de stockage des données, la stratégie de migration et de l’archivage des données.
Qualités requises pour réussir dans ce rôle
Détenir un diplôme universitaire de premier cycle (baccalauréat) dans le domaine des technologies de l’information (informatique, génie logiciel ou génie informatique);
 Posséder une expérience d’au moins dix (10) ans en technologie de l'information, dont au moins cinq (5) ans comme conseiller en architecture d'intelligence d'affaires ou comme architecte de données; Expérience avec Microsoft SQL Server (SSMS, SSIS, SSRS); Maîtriser la conception et l’optimisation de requêtes SQL complexes; Maitriser les approches BI classiques (Inmon, Kimball) et les techniques BI classiques (modélisation dimensionnelle, data lake, ODS, DW, DM) ; Maitriser la modélisation relationnelle et multidimensionnelle et en modélisation logique et physique; Avoir réalisé un mandat dans la mise en place d’entrepôts de données, ODS et comptoirs de données; Parfait bilingue anflais, français écrit et oral ; Atout : Connaissances Power BI Service Atout : Connaissances DevOps et Agile Atout : Connaissances des composantes BI dans Azure (Data Factory, Data Lake Gen 2, Databricks, Synapse)
Allier savoir et faire
Alors que la technologie s’inscrit au cœur de la transformation numérique de nos clients, nous savons que les individus sont au cœur du succès en affaires.
Lorsque vous rejoignez CGI, vous devenez un conseiller de confiance, collaborant avec vos collègues et clients pour proposer des idées exploitables qui produisent des résultats concrets et durables. Nous appelons nos employés "membres" parce qu’ils sont actionnaires et propriétaires de CGI. Ils ont du plaisir à travailler et à grandir ensemble pour bâtir une entreprise dont nous sommes fiers. C’est notre rêve depuis 1976. Il nous a menés là où nous sommes aujourd’hui – l’une des plus importantes entreprises indépendantes de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.
Chez CGI, nous reconnaissons la richesse que la diversité nous apporte. Nous aspirons à créer une culture à laquelle nous appartenons tous et collaborons avec nos clients pour créer des communautés plus inclusives. En tant qu’employeur qui prône l’égalité des chances pour tous, nous voulons donner à tous nos membres les moyens de réussir et de s’épanouir. Si vous avez besoin d’un accompagnement spécifique durant le processus de recrutement et d’intégration, veuillez nous en informer. Nous serons heureux de vous aider.
Prêt à faire partie d’une entreprise qui est gage d’excellence? Rejoignez CGI – où vos idées et vos actions changent la donne.
Spécialiste BI
Position Description
Spécialiste BI
Your future duties and responsibilities
Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role
Insights you can act on
While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.
When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees “members” because they are CGI shareholders and owners, and, as owners, we enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today—one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.
At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where everyone belongs, and we collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal opportunity employer, we empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.
Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI—where your ideas and actions make a difference.
companyDescription:
Insights you can act on

Founded in 1976, CGI is among the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world. We are insights-driven and outcomes-based to help accelerate returns on your investments. Across 21 industries in 400 locations worldwide, we provide comprehensive, scalable and sustainable IT and business consulting services that are informed globally and delivered locally.

We value your opinions and welcome your comments and questions on our posts here on LinkedIn. Please keep a polite, professional and constructive tone. We remove comments containing objectionable language and derogatory views. Note that content on this page contains general information regarding CGI’s services and initiatives and should not be considered direct business advice. To engage in a discussion with one of our experts, please contact us directly at info@cgi.com.

jobDescription:
DRW is a diversified trading firm with over 3 decades of experience bringing sophisticated technology and exceptional people together to operate in markets around the world. We value autonomy and the ability to quickly pivot to capture opportunities, so we operate using our own capital and trading at our own risk.

Headquartered in Chicago with offices throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia, we trade a variety of asset classes including Fixed Income, ETFs, Equities, FX, Commodities and Energy across all major global markets. We have also leveraged our expertise and technology to expand into three non-traditional strategies: real estate, venture capital and cryptoassets.

We operate with respect, curiosity and open minds. The people who thrive here share our belief that it’s not just what we do that matters–it's how we do it. DRW is a place of high expectations, integrity, innovation and a willingness to challenge consensus.

We are currently hiring a Data Analyst to join our Data Acquisition team, working in close collaboration with our Trading Strategy group. Candidates must have a passion for data and its dissemination, and the ability to think both independently and collaboratively. They will assist in the preparation of data collection strategies by collecting and processing data from a variety of sources.

Candidates must be comfortable working within a fast-paced, and at times highly demanding environment. They must possess a keen sense of enthusiasm and attention to detail, as well as a sense of commitment and dedication to both teams. New Grads are welcome!

You’ll Feel Right At Home If You
Have exceptional attention to detail and data gathering skillsAre able to balance several time sensitive requestsAre able to learn and adapt to proprietary tools and database systemsBasic knowledge of company earnings reports (bonus)Have an interest in learning about global markets and equities, and how information is disseminated thereinAre resourceful at searching for detailed informationHave effective communication skills (oral and written).Are willing to learn and adapt to a quickly-changing environmentHave completed a Bachelor’s degree in a related field - economics, finance, commerce, Information Technology or computer scienceHave knowledge of Bloomberg and Reuters Eikon terminals (considered a bonus but not required)Basic knowledge of automation using python (considered a bonus but not required)
What You’ll Be Working On
Preparing and deploying configurations of data collection strategies for use by analysts and tradersCollaborating with the research and trading teams in both pre- and post- trade analysis to prepare detailed reports and investigationsOperate proprietary tools and systems and troubleshoot issues in real-timeCollaborating with different teams to design and maintain state-of-the-art operations platformsDesigning proprietary process automation and monitoring tools and leveraging third-party technologies as appropriate
What DRW Montreal Has To Offer You
Recognized as one of Canada’s Best Employers for the past 8 yearsCommitted to continuous learning & developmentIndustry leading benefits package and perksFocused on employee well-being and work-life balanceCommunity initiatives, volunteer program and opportunities for giving back
Find out more about all of our perks & benefits here

For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice.

California residents, please review the California Privacy Notice for information about certain legal rights at https://drw.com/california-privacy-notice.
companyDescription:
At DRW, we identify and capture trading and investment opportunities globally. What sets us apart is our diversified approach—trading across many asset classes and instruments, in markets around the world, with horizons from seconds to years. We succeed by leveraging technology, research and risk management.

We offer the best of both worlds: the opportunity and spirit of a startup and the benefits and stability of an established, experienced firm. Our employees work hard to solve interesting problems, and their results are rewarded. We value continuous learning—from our outcomes, from the environment and from each other. It’s a place of high expectations, deep curiosity, and constant collaboration, with some of the smartest, most passionate people you’ll meet.
//
Chez DRW, nous identifions et saisissons les opportunités de négociation et d'investissement au niveau mondial. Ce qui nous différencie, c'est notre approche diversifiée : nous négocions sur de nombreuses classes d'actifs et d'instruments, sur des marchés du monde entier, avec des horizons allant de quelques secondes à plusieurs années. Nous réussissons en nous appuyant sur la technologie, la recherche et la gestion des risques. Nous offrons le meilleur des deux mondes: les opportunités et l'ésprit d’une entreprise en démarrage, et les avantages et la stabilité d'une entreprise établie et expérimentée. Nos employés travaillent dur pour résoudre des problèmes intéressants et leurs résultats sont récompensés. Nous valorisons l'apprentissage continu – de nos résultats, de l’environnement et de chacun de nous. C’est un lieu où les attentes sont élevées, la curiosité est profonde et la collaboration est constante, et où l’on retrouve quelques-uns des individus les plus intelligents et les plus passionnés que vous puissiez rencontrer.

jobDescription:
We are looking to hire multiple detail-oriented, technically-minded people to join the Data Analysis team at DarkVision. The successful candidates will work collaboratively with their teammates to analyze our high-resolution ultrasound scans of oil and gas wells. They will use the results to create actionable reports, 3D images, detailed models, and quantifiable data to help our clients make informed decisions on the safe and efficient operations of their multi-million dollar operating assets.
No experience in this type of role is necessary, as the focus is on attitude, aptitude, and raw ability versus specific experience in a similar position. We're looking for someone intelligent, keen, and highly detail-oriented regarding data deliverables to help meet the growing demand for DarkVision's products and services.
As our scope increases, we require some Analysts who are apt to work odd hours. Willingness to work odd hours is considered an asset though not required.
Responsibilities: Inspect ultrasound data using our proprietary software to locate features and defectsFollow detailed processes for preparing datasets and completing analysisMeasure and assess features in the data, utilizing Machine Learning / AI generated resultsGenerate detailed spreadsheets and plots using MATLABGenerate and edit reportsGenerate images, videos, and 3D rendersReview and aggregate information from client documentsAssist in improving workflows and documentationLearn and master new types of analysis as DarkVision increases its product offerings
Work Arrangement / Hours: Willing and able to work out of DarkVision's North Vancouver head office; this is a fully on-site positionAvailable for occasional odd hours; customer jobs can arise at any time, and they often need answers as quickly as possibleThis position may include occasional working evenings or weekends outside of typical office hours
Expectations: Diploma or degree from a STEM fieldExtreme attention-to-detail; you need to be meticulous, methodical, exact, and thorough in your analysis, making little to no mistakesExcellent communication skills, verbal and writtenWork well collaboratively; most projects will be shared among a group of AnalystsFast learner; able to adapt to evolving processes and guidelinesAble to follow detailed procedures and meet high standards for quality and consistency
Bonus Qualifications: MATLAB experienceBlender or Meshlab experienceImage processing experienceExperience with 3D data
What's in it for you? Competitive salary or higher (Top $ for top talent)Full benefits package.Competitive vacation allotmentFlexible work environment
About DarkVision
DarkVision Technologies Inc. is a BC-based tech company that has been disrupting the industrial imaging market since 2013. We have created the world’s most advanced acoustic-based imaging platform and are packaging it into multiple new product lines, revolutionizing how our clients quantify and visualize the integrity of their critical assets.
Backed by Koch Industries, the largest privately held company in North America, DarkVision’s team of Mechanical, Skunkworks, Electrical, Software, and Machine Learning Engineers is rapidly expanding to meet the demand for the company’s current and upcoming products.We provide employees the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies that blend science with real-world applications and invite you to join our team for the exciting journey ahead as we become the global leader in industrial imaging.
Why DarkVision
Here are 4 reasons you’ll like working at DarkVision:
Well-Funded: We are backed by Koch Industries - North America’s largest privately held company and are actively working with top-tier operators across North America.‘A’ Players: Our team is made up of talented, intelligent, and hardworking people. If you’re an ‘A’ player, you’ll enjoy the intellectually stimulating, challenging and respectfully competitive atmosphere.Growing Quickly: We are in the process of launching several new product lines and as a result, have more than doubled our headcount over the last year.Lots of Opportunities: We are transitioning into a much larger organization and recently expanded into a 52,000 sq ft facility in North Vancouver. We have recently opened a larger Calgary office and have expanded into the US with offices in Houston and Midland, TX.
companyDescription:
DarkVision Technologies Inc. is a BC-based tech company that has been disrupting the industrial imaging market since 2013. We have created the world’s most advanced acoustic-based imaging platform and are packaging it into multiple new product lines. Our rapidly growing team of experts from machine vision, medical imaging, aerospace design, and computer graphics have come together to revolutionize how industry quantifies and visualizes the integrity of critical assets.

DarkVision’s first product line for tubular infrastructure inspection has been highly disruptive to the market; it has won multiple industry awards, been featured in top industry publications, and generated significant revenue. We are now scaling the technology to numerous industrial verticals and building a platform to become the dominant player in the asset integrity game.

DarkVision’s proprietary technology captures the world’s largest ultrasound datasets by orders of magnitude. To do this, we design, build, and sell the entire solution ourselves. Our teams specialize in large sensor arrays, high-speed electronics, advanced ultrasound imaging techniques, 3D visualizations, and ML-based analytics software. DarkVision’s staff of Mechanical Engineers, Electrical Engineers, Software Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, and Research Scientists develop cutting-edge technologies that blend science with real-world applications.  

Backed by Koch Industries, North America’s largest privately held company, DarkVision has begun scaling its Engineering, Sales, and Operations teams to meet the demand for both its current and upcoming products. Our head office is newly renovated 52,000+ sq ft facility in Vancouver and we have offices in Calgary, Alberta, Houston and Midland, Texas. 

We invite you to join our team for the exciting journey ahead as we become the global leader in industrial imaging.

jobDescription:
Description
Responsible for data analysis, validation, cleansing, collection and reporting . Extract and analyze data from various sources, including databases, manual files, and external websites. Respond to data inquiries from various groups within an organization. Create and publish regularly scheduled and/or ad hoc reports as needed. Document reporting requirements and process and validate data components as required. Experience with relational databases and knowledge of query tools and/or statistical software required. Strong analytical and organizational skills required. Must possess expert level knowledge of MS Excel . 5+ years of prior experience as a Data Analyst is required.
Job Description
 Ensure data integrity, accuracy and quality, attend to the needs of routine management reporting and ad-hoc strategic reporting.  Perform advanced data analysis for internal stakeholders, report on obtained insights.  Provide support to data driven projects/tasks and drive automation of reports.  Support in developing, managing, and executing controls and processes aligned to Procurement policies.  May act as liaison between business areas and project team stake holders for the development and implementation of new processes/ systems and enhancement of existing processes/systems.  May prepare communications and make presentations on delivered reports and improved process. 
Skills
 Looking for an experienced Data Analyst  Knowledge of SQL is essential to build and run queries essential  PowerBI experience would be nice.  Experience of Ad-Hoc reporting  Strong knowledge of Excel is essential including pivot tables and power queries.  The successful candidate will have the opportunity to learn a new P2P tool called Ivalua, however if they have Ivalua experience already they will be looked upon very favourably .  Experience of data analysis tools and databases is essential  Ideally 3-5 experience ideally in a similar industry or company.  Someone who can read and make sense of data with big company experience. 
Key Accountabilities
 Data : understand the data and its source; and explain, reconcile and/or mitigate cross-system discrepancies; troubleshoot the reporting database environment and reports  Analytics : understand user requirements; locate the type and source of data needed; develop approach and strategy to analysis; build metrics, methodologies and/or finance models to facilitate analysis  Reporting : generate analytic findings or other relevant information into informal or formal reports; visualize data in support of analytic findings; design report in user-friendly fashion and digitized manner; and train end-users on new reports and dashboards.  Insight : formulate recommendations and/or solutions out of findings to assist in decision-making; propose alternatives when faced with issues; and explore opportunity for improvement  Communication : communicate needs and wants in day-to-day work, and present and/or elaborate on completed work/project to user  Compliance : attend to company procedures and processes; and focus on integrity, prudence, and consistency. 
Required Qualifications
 Graduate of bachelor’s degree or above; minimum 5 years of related working experience  Analytic skills: familiar with financial reporting and analysis, strong presentation and case study skills  Tools: proven competence in advanced Excel functions (macros and scripts) and other Microsoft applications (e.g. Word, PPT, Visio, SharePoint and Outlook)  Reporting skills: demonstrated experience in formal reporting (ability in design is preferred)  Technical skills: strong knowledge of common querying languages (e.g. SQL) and visualization tools ( PowerBI ); demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.  Communication: high-level written and verbal communication skills; proven ability in translating business requirements into non-technical and lay terms and in communicating insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management  English skills: fluent speaking, reading, and writing is a must 
Preferred Qualifications
 Proven analytical skills to evaluate information/data from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high level information into details and make data-driven strategic recommendations  Excellent communicator and multi-tasking problem solver  Self-starter, attentive to details, well-organized and team oriented  Willing to work on flexible shift 
Training Curriculums
Team Internal Training
 Team Introduction (Role and Responsibilities)  Introduction to internal and external data sources and databases  Introduction to managed data flows and models  Introduction to managed KPIs and ongoing projects  Technical documentations 
Online Training
 Team Site Materials (Guide and Methodology)  Corp Finance Resources: IFS, CERT, Concur, and SCM  Global Ops Resources: MOR, MIS, and Procurement KPIs  External Resources: Ivalua, Amex GBT and FieldGlass  E2E Project Documentations 
General Training
 Fuel Up Friday - Featured Courses  Linkedin /Pursuit  Ivalua L1 certification
companyDescription:
Robertson & Company Ltd. is a leading professional services firm providing recruitment-related, advisory and consulting services to corporations, professional organizations, governments, and public & private institutions.

RELATIONSHIP VERSUS TRANSACTION

Success in the recruitment services industry depends on deep relationships built on trust and performance. Our focus is never simply on the transaction at hand but on what is best for our client, both today and in the long run. We consider this unique approach and perspective to be the driving force behind our continued success in this highly competitive space.

DEEP INDUSTRY EXPERIENCE 

While we work with many industries, Robertson & Company has exceptional experience and a proven track record with some of North America's leading financial institutions. We understand the needs of the industry and its inner workings better than any other recruitment firm. This is evidenced by our enviable client retention rate of nearly 100%.

A PROVEN TRACK RECORD

In our world, longevity is based on consistently delivering time and time again. Robertson & Company has just such a proven track record of performance. Our commitment to exceptional client communication, the use of proprietary screening and selection processes and an uncompromising commitment to excellence has served both us and our clients well.

Robertson is a Proud Certified Diversity Supplier.

jobDescription:
“Are you passionate about recycling and sustainability and want to make a positive impact for the environment and society?”  A prerequisite for a functioning circular economy is that all products and materials are returned after use. RLG has a vision of building and operating a reverse supply chain for our customers that optimizes collection and recycling in order to maximize materials recovered for use in new products and packaging while driving innovation.  Reverse Logistics Group (RLG) is seeking a BI Data Analyst to expand our environmental compliance solutions with a focus on supporting the implementation of Ontario’s future Blue Box program, supporting other business lines, and supporting our growing Canada team. RLG is a tech-enabled service provider with twenty-four offices worldwide. We serve some of the world’s largest producers, e-commerce, and retail organizations in over eighty countries. In 2021, RLG expanded its operations into Canada. We are a small dynamic start-up team working together in Canada with ambitious growth plans to accelerate our impact. Job Description The Business Intelligence Data Analyst will work collectively and collaboratively with RLG’s Operations team, IT and Software Product Development team. Primarily, in this role, you will be supporting the various Operational service delivery functions and, secondarily, supporting staff in other divisions and their activities. 
Your Key Responsibilities:Support the Operations team and other internal stakeholders with operational data reconciliation contributing to operational invoice reviews and approvalSupport IT and Product Development team to integrate Power BI with RLG’s softwarePrepare data for analysis, model data in Microsoft Power BI, and visualize data of operational and business activitiesDesign and build scalable data models, clean and transform data, and enable advanced analytic capabilities that provide meaningful business valueConstruct tables, views, and reports from multiple data sources, to enable key decision-makingGenerate standard monthly reports for review and approval by internal stakeholdersGenerate standard and ad-hoc reports based on specific operational requests and projectsOther duties as assigned
Your Profile:College Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in statistics, engineering, or mathematicsFundamental understanding of data repositories and data processes, both on-premises and in the cloudPower BI skills (e.g. data visualization, relational databases, SQL, DAX, power query, and similar BI tools)Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate considered an assetMinimum of two years of relevant work experience Confident in the Microsoft Office environment, especially Excel. Experience with pivot tables, lookups, conditional formatting, array formulas etc. considered an assetData Studio and/or other connector toolsStrong data analysis skills with a holistic business views to suggest improvements and correctionsStrong organizational skills and customer service focusedProfessional communication skills (written and verbal)Self motivated, and competent when working independently, and within teamsCapable of working with high efficiency and accuracy under time pressuresDemonstrated ability to handle confidential informationPossess a flexible, adaptable approach with a high level of responsiveness to business needs
What to expect:Comprehensive employer paid health and dental benefits from day 1Employer matching of employee RSP contributionRLG is supportive of professional development and training, with opportunities to work globallyRLG has a dynamic international working environment: 39 nationalities with diverse backgroundsHybrid position: two days a week from home and three days a week from our office in downtown Toronto Should you require accommodation or support in any aspect of our recruitment and selection process, we will work with you to meet your needs.
companyDescription:
As a strategic partner for manufacturers, retailers and governmental organizations, the REVERSE LOGISTICS GROUP (RLG) globally addresses complex challenges from product and material returns and provides new levels of business intelligence, customer satisfaction and resource efficiency.

We build and operate comprehensive networks of high level, appropriate service providers to process reverse flows in the most efficient way. In parallel, dedicated teams monitor legislation, manage product data and report fulfillment to ensure environmental compliance. 
Our unique combination of market independence process excellence and innovative IT systems facilitate immediate transparency and consistent standards within the actual return process and beyond. 

RLG solutions are designed to protect and generate value from product returns and to ensure regulatory compliance. Through our holistic approach, our clients are empowered to unlock growth potential from improved remarketing, product design, sales planning and material supply and to create true circular material flows.

RLG has a global presence with offices in over 20 countries in Europe, the Americas and Asia. We provide services in more than 80 countries managing over 500 million assets p.a. for some of the largest global OEM, e-commerce and retail organizations.

jobTitle: Student Intern, Data Analyst & Quote Controller
jobDescription:
Req ID: 110323

Region: Americas

Country: Canada

State/Province: Ontario

City: Toronto

16 Month Internship

Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) is a US$5.8 billion global leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions. We bring global expertise and insight at every stage of product development - from the drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services. Through our unrivalled customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in aerospace and defense, communications, enterprise, healthtech, industrial, capital equipment, and smart energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges.

Celestica is a high-integrity work environment and when you join Celestica you are a part of a leading global company that enables the world’s best brands, and contributing to our innovative and collaborative solutions that help our customers unlock the potential of the future.

Our global network spans 14 countries with 24,500 employees across the Americas, Europe and Asia. At our Toronto headquarters, we are focused on attracting top talent into our organization, including interns from universities and colleges throughout Southern Ontario.

Celestica's internship program provides students with valuable development through real-life work experience, exciting projects and networking with industry professionals.

Benefits For Students Include
Experience working for one of the largest Canadian global technology companiesPossibility of a student casual contract position after completion of internshipPossibility of a full-time position after completion of degreeAccess to Celestica’s development programs and projectsCelestica's Time Off to Volunteer program – two paid days off to volunteer per yearFun intern activities including celebration events and networkingInternal recognition programs and rewards for stellar performance
What’s in it for you?
 Opportunity: Job experience at a large Canadian-based global company Innovation: We look to our employees to implement new ideas and improve the way we do thingsCollaboration: Students work as part of global teams, enabled by collaborative technologySustainability: We uphold strong ethics, reduce our impact on the environment and empower employees to give back to the community with two paid days off per year to volunteerDevelopment opportunities: including soft skills courses, innovation projects and mentorshipNetworking: Strategically build your professional network to advance your career and deepen relationships across your peers and colleagues.Fun: Our interns have the opportunity to participate in fun activities including intern social events, Celestica’s charitable initiatives and our Spirit Week activities
About This Opportunity

The Indirect Procurement team is responsible for ensuring that products and services purchased are provided with the best value and quality for what is required. They are responsible for developing contracts, managing the vendor selection process, monitoring spending and driving policy compliance for audits. The team is split into different commodities (e.g. Equipment, IT Hardware, Labour) with dedicated Commodity Managers who manage them. This team is highly energized and is successfully driven by their team approach and customer focus attitude.

The data analyst portion of the role is to drive understanding around the Global Spend and Savings for the company with respect to indirect products and services. These analytics helps to ensure the company runs successfully. The opportunity allows for global data trend analysis across a number of business functions around the globe. The data is reported to various senior leaders in the company including the CPO.

The quote controller portion of the role acts as the Indirect Procurement “Request for Quote/Information” (RFX) focal point between external and internal stakeholders. You are the communication engine of the department.

This role combines data analytics with business savvy communication development opportunities. This individual should be self-driven, have interest in continuous improvement and a willingness to support their team. Students will have the opportunity to work in the Corporate Supply Chain and develop skills in supply chain/commodity business practices, communications, analytics, as well as advanced proficiency in various Microsoft products, project management and Global interaction experience.

Students will enjoy a stimulating and challenging work environment with opportunities to develop many skills, while working in a highly motivated team. This position is ideal for students that are currently enrolled in 3rd or 4th year from Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Commerce/Finance, or Social Sciences.

Preferred Skills
A self starter with the ability to pull in knowledge of different tools to solve unique and complex problemsData VisualizationA team player with strong communication and interpersonal skillsExcellent PC skills (database software and major desktop applications)Proficient in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel (analysis, pivot tables & vlookup)Familiar with Google applications including Google Drive, Mail, Calendar etc.Excellent time management and prioritizationAbility to meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environmentAbility to work autonomously once trainedExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsFlexibility to work extended hours as per customer needsInquisitive and detailed oriented (comfortable asking questions)Ability to learn and quickly develop new skills
Nice To Have Skills
Has worked with either Python/RExperience in SQLExperience in Power BIKnowledge of manufacturing, procurement and electronics industrySome education and/or experience in the finance or accounting field
Activities
Create and Manage Dashboards based on Executive and Regional NeedsAutomate and manage existing workflows with Python and PowerAppsUpdating and Maintaining Databases in Azure and other Software.Compile, analyze and reporting of indirect procurement dataCreate and present a Monthly Operating ReportAssist Commodity Managers with spend analysis and the categorization of key spend areaPerform routine reporting tasks that involve spend, performance reports and invoice analysisSend out RFX packages, manage proposals, timelines, questions & answers related to RFQsSetting up NDA documents with potential vendorsDevelop vendor comparison charts (price, capabilities)Set up site visits and vendor meetingsParticipate to volunteering activities within Celestica volunteer programs
Physical Demands, duties of this position are varied and will include:
Duties of this position are performed in a normal office with exposure to manufacturing environments.Duties may require extended periods of sitting and sustained visual concentration on a computer monitor or on numbers and other detailed dataRepetitive manual movements are frequently required (e.g. data entry, using a computer mouse, using a calculator, etc).
Area: Global Supply Chain Management – Global Indirect Procurement

Start Date: May 2023

Location: 5140 Yonge Street, Toronto

Experience: No formal experience required.

Education: Currently enrolled in a University Internship program. Preference to those completing 3rd year of a 4 year program in Economics, Computer Science, and Business.

To apply, please visit www.celestica.com. Please provide a copy of your transcript with your application. Please include your student email address in your application. 

Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law).

At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Special arrangements can be made for candidates who need it throughout the hiring process. Please indicate your needs and we will work with you to meet them.
companyDescription: Celestica enables the world's best brands. Through our unrivalled customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in aerospace and defense, communications, enterprise, healthtech, industrial, capital equipment, and smart energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. A leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development - from the drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services. With talented teams across North America, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers..

jobTitle: Premier ou première analyste, Science des données et de l’industrie
jobDescription:
Travailler à CBC/Radio-Canada 

À CBC/Radio-Canada, nous avons pour mission de créer des contenus qui informent, divertissent et rassemblent la population canadienne sur de multiples plateformes. Nos réussites et nos réalisations reposent sur les valeurs auxquelles nous adhérons : la créativité, l’intégrité, l’inclusion et la pertinence.

Vous pensez avoir la capacité et la motivation d’évoluer dans un milieu bouillonnant et en constante transformation? Que ce soit pour travailler devant la caméra, au micro, en ligne ou dans les coulisses, vous pourriez faire partie d’une équipe qui réussit à créer des liens et à présenter des sujets qui passionnent le public canadien.

 Votre mandat 

En tant que membre du groupe de la Recherche institutionnelle de CBC/Radio-Canada, vous ferez partie d’une équipe dynamique dans un rôle combinant l'analyse de données et l'analyse de l'industrie. À ce poste, vous aurez à diriger et soutenir un éventail de projets de recherche complexes sur l’industrie des médias plus particulièrement au Canada, mais aussi au sujet de la radiodiffusion publique, au Canada comme à l’étranger. Vous participerez à la conception des projets, à l’analyse des données et à la rédaction de rapports dans le cadre de divers projets. Votre travail portera sur les médias et l’industrie des communications, et vous fournirez des analyses et des observations sur les activités et les tendances de l’industrie. Vous développerez et appuierez des projets fondés sur les données, ainsi que des outils et des infrastructures afin de mesurer les habitudes de consommation des auditoires multiplateformes et leurs perceptions de CBC/Radio-Canada.

 Responsabilités 
 Élaborer des tableaux de bord institutionnels et d’autres outils libre-service automatisés de production de rapports en utilisant Excel et PowerBI, afin de faire ressortir des données importantes et des observations pour les parties intéressées.  Participer à l’établissement des données sur les auditoires et des mesures de rendement des auditoires fournies dans les rapports réglementaires ou financiers, dans le plan d’entreprise annuel, dans le plan stratégique d’entreprise, ainsi que dans des rapports mensuels et des analyses ponctuelles.  Préparer des projets innovants, et y collaborer en vue de mesurer les habitudes de consommation des auditoires multiplateformes et leurs perceptions des services de CBC/Radio-Canada, à partir de sources de données primaires ou secondaires, ou provenant de tiers.  Collaborer à la préparation et la mise en œuvre de changements stratégiques fondés sur les données, afin d’obtenir un portrait global des auditoires sur toutes les plateformes.  Travailler en partenariat avec nos équipes de l’Exploitation des données afin de développer les exigences relatives à l’infrastructure des données sur les auditoires.  Participer à l’élaboration et à la préparation de documents complexes sur l’industrie, de manière à présenter les tendances et les changements de l’industrie aux membres de la haute direction afin de les informer des répercussions sur la Société et le paysage de la radiodiffusion au Canada dans son ensemble.  Présenter les conclusions aux parties intéressées de l’interne au besoin.  Synthétiser des ensembles de données et de l’information afin de comprendre les mutations de l’industrie et d’interpréter leurs répercussions sur l’industrie des médias au Canada et sur CBC/Radio-Canada plus précisément.  Comprendre les changements des habitudes de consommation des médias, interpréter ces changements, et communiquer ces observations à la haute direction pour l’aider dans la prise de décisions stratégiques.  Passer en revue les rapports de l’industrie, les bulletins, les publications et les ensembles de données pour se tenir au courant des principaux changements en cours dans l’industrie des médias. 
Profil Recherché
 Bilinguisme (français et anglais) – un atout.  Diplôme d’une université reconnue avec une spécialisation acceptable en science des données, en informatique, en gestion des affaires, en économie, en études des médias, ou dans une discipline pertinente.  Minimum d’une année d’expérience en analytique, en science des données, en informatique ou en intelligence d’affaires.  Sens poussé de l’analyse, et capacité de comprendre, d’interpréter, d’évaluer et de présenter des données ou des propositions d’affaires complexes.  Compréhension approfondie des données et des tendances de l’industrie des médias (nationale et internationale; des marchés anglophones et francophones; des plateformes traditionnelles et numériques), de l’environnement réglementaire national, de la législation actuelle et à venir en radiodiffusion, des enjeux et des mouvements sociaux, et des meilleures pratiques internationales – un atout.  Des aptitudes pour la résolution de problèmes stratégiques sont essentielles, puisque ce poste nécessite souvent de faire preuve d’innovation pour trouver des solutions à des problèmes complexes.  Compréhension des principes financiers de base, y compris les mesures et les ratios financiers, les estimations et les tendances en la matière, etc. – un atout.  Capacité d’établir des liens entre de multiples sources pour faciliter la prise de décisions éclairées.  Expérience en modélisation de statistiques et de données, pour fournir des solutions fondées sur l’analytique en vue de relever des défis opérationnels.  Expérience pratique en visualisation de données et en production de rapports avec des outils tels que PowerBI  Maîtrise de MS Excel (y compris des techniques avancées), de MS PowerPoint, et de la suite Google (y compris les présentations et les feuilles de calcul).  Maîtrise des outils, des langages et des logiciels utilisés en analyse statistique (Python, R, SAS, STATA) – un atout.  Maîtrise des langages logiciels pour les bases de données (SQL). Capacité de concevoir et de tenir à jour des processus d’extraction, d’intégration et d’interrogation de données provenant de différentes sources. Expérience en rédaction de scripts pour la manipulation de données, l’apprentissage machine et l’automatisation de pipelines de données – un atout.  Capacité d’expliquer clairement des concepts et des analyses techniques à divers niveaux de membres de la direction.  Entregent. Capacité de travailler aussi bien de façon autonome qu’au sein d’une équipe.  Excellentes compétences en communication (orale et écrite) en anglais et/ou en français.  Capacité de comprendre les besoins actuels et d’envisager les besoins potentiels des clients.  Capacité de maintenir un haut niveau de concentration et d’organisation ainsi que capacité de respecter des délais serrés et de gérer de multiples priorités.  Souci du détail.  Initiative et créativité.  Enthousiasme et attitude positive! 
Vous devrez peut-être passer des tests de compétences et de connaissances.

Si ce poste vous intéresse, cliquez sur « Postuler en ligne ». Nous vous remercions de votre intérêt, toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes retenues pour une entrevue.

CBC/Radio-Canada s’engage à être un chef de file dans la représentation de la diversité canadienne. Pourquoi cet engagement? C’est que pour pouvoir créer et raconter des histoires rassembleuses, nous devons nous appuyer sur un effectif à l’image de la société canadienne en constante évolution. C’est la raison pour laquelle, en tant qu’employeur, nous valorisons l’égalité des chances et favorisons un milieu de travail inclusif, où nos différences individuelles sont non seulement reconnues et mises en valeur, mais se retrouvent également dans tous les services que nous offrons comme diffuseur public du Canada. Pour plus d’information, visitez la section Diversité et inclusion de notre site web. Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation à cette étape du recrutement, veuillez nous en informer dès que possible en envoyant un courriel à recrutement@radio-canada.ca.

Nous vous invitons à consulter notre Code de conduite sur notre site institutionnel . Tous les membres de notre effectif sont tenus de respecter ce code de conduite, car son application constitue une condition d'emploi. Nous vous invitons également à consulter notre politique sur les conflits d'intérêts . Si vous vous joignez à notre équipe, il sera important de nous aviser le plus rapidement possible de toute situation qui pourrait constituer ou être perçue comme constituant un conflit d’intérêts, compte tenu de vos nouvelles fonctions.

Nous nous efforçons de rédiger nos affichages de la manière la plus inclusive possible. Si toutefois l'un des deux genres est utilisé seul dans cet affichage, il désigne les personnes de tout genre.
